intro: Quararibea bilobata, commonly known as the two-lobed quina, is a flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its palmate leaves with five to seven lobes. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale pink, arranged in clusters. Its bark and leaves contain compounds used in traditional medicine for their antimalarial and anti-inflammatory properties. Quararibea bilobata thrives in humid, shaded environments and is an important component of the tropical forest ecosystem.
